question: Who did the king meet while hunting one day?
answer1: a man whose head was out through his cap, whose elbows and knees were out through his clothing, and whose toes were out through his shoes

question: What did the man do to the king?
answer1: gave him a blow on the face, and drove three teeth from his mouth

question: What happened after the man blew on the king?
answer1: The same blow put the King's head in the dirt.

question: Where did the king go when he rose from the earth?
answer1: back to his castle

question: How did the king feel as he laid down sick?
answer1: sorrowful

question: Who were the king's sons?
answer1: Ur
answer2: Arthur
answer3: Lawn Dyarrig

question: Where were the sons before they came home?
answer1: at school

question: What did Ur said he would do if he met the man?
answer1: He would make four parts of him between four horses.

question: Why did the king tell Lawn Dyarrig he was not his son?
answer1: The king would not lose lands or property on him.

question: What was the order given to Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: leave the castle and make his own way for himself

question: Why were the two elder brothers going to travel the world?
answer1: to know could they find the man who had injured their father

question: What did Lawn Dyarrig think was strange?
answer1: Two men of high degree went travelling without a servant.

question: Who was the two brothers' serving-boy?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig

question: Where did the brothers come late to?
answer1: a house

question: What did the woman do when she saw Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: kissed and welcomed, called him son of the King of Erin

question: What did the woman and the brothers do in the second part?
answer1: told tales

question: What happened after the three had eaten?
answer1: The woman spoke to Ur.

question: How did Ur's father lose three teeth?
answer1: A champion met his father, and took three teeth from him.

question: Who did the woman say the man was?
answer1: the Green Knight from Terrible Valley

question: Where was the Green Knight from?
answer1: Terrible Valley

question: What did the woman say she never saw?
answer1: one coming back

question: What did Lawn Dyarrig say when the woman asked he was going?
answer1: He was going with them as a servant.

question: Who took the daughter?
answer1: the Green Knight of Terrible Valley

question: What did the woman advise Ur to do?
answer1: go home to his father

question: What happened after Lawn Dyarrig first shook the old sword?
answer1: He knocked seven barrels of rust out of it.

question: What did the woman supply Lawn Dyarrig with?
answer1: apparel of a hero
answer2: the slim white steed

question: Where will the white steed stop?
answer1: the Eastern World

question: What will Lawn Dyarrig do when he arrives in the Eastern World?
answer1: come down, and cut the turf under the steed's beautiful right front foot

question: Where did Lawn Dyarrig find the white steed?
answer1: the stable

question: What did the horse do at every leap?
answer1: crossed seven hills and valleys, seven castles with villages, acres, roods, and odd perches

question: What happened after Lawn Dyarrig cut the sod under the foot of the steed?
answer1: He tightened the reins on the neck of the steed and let him go home.

question: What did the brothers say they would rather do?
answer1: make a basket

question: What happened after Lawn Dyarrig came to the opening with the gads all twisted and made into one?
answer1: The brothers hadn't the ribs of the basket in the ground yet.

question: Why did the brothers call Lawn Dyarrig a quick workman?
answer1: While they'd be putting one rod in the basket Lawn Dyarrig had the basket finished.

question: Who would go in the basket?
answer1: Ur

question: What will the brothers do if Ur sees something frightening?
answer1: The brothers will draw him up.

question: Who did Lawn Dyarrig meet guarding the Terrible Valley?
answer1: seven hundred heroes

question: What happened after the heroes faced Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: They attacked Lawn Dyarrig, but he went through them like a hawk or a raven through small birds.

question: What happened to Lawn Dyarrig after he drank water?
answer1: He laid on the ground and fell asleep.

question: Who did the lady in the Green Knight's castle send for water?
answer1: a maid

question: Why did the mistress complain of the maid?
answer1: for being so long

question: What did the maid think she saw near the spring?
answer1: a deadman

question: Why did the maid say Lawn Dyarrig was at the spring?
answer1: The finest hero that ever a woman laid eyes on was sleeping at the spring.

question: What did the mistress do when she saw Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: smothered him with kisses
answer2: drowned him with tears
answer3: dried him with garments of fine silk and with her own hair

question: What did the mistress say was the bond the Green Knight had to follow?
answer1: not to marry her for seven years and a day

question: Who did the Green Knight order to bring back the heart of Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: three hundred heroes

question: What did the Green Knight want to eat from Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: his liver and heart

question: Why did the Green Knight believe Lawn Dyarrig must have exercised?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig must have had some exercise to delay the Green Knight's men, they are so long away.

question: What happened after Lawn Dyarrig caught the bulkiest hero?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig began to wallop the others with him, and he walloped them till he drove the life out of the two hundred and ninety-nine.

question: How did the knight feel when the brass head told him about Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: sorrow

question: What did Lawn Dyarrig ask the mistress to make ready for him?
answer1: a clean long chamber

question: What happened after the dinner?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig put his finger under the mistress' girdle, took her to the best chamber in the castle, and stood on guard upon it till morning.

question: What will happen if the Green Knight strikes the pole of combat first?
answer1: The Green Knight will win the day.

question: What did the mistress tell Lawn Dyarrig to do when the Green Knight was ready to strike?
answer1: give him a blow with the sod

question: What will the Green Knight turn into when struck?
answer1: a green stone

question: What did the lady tell Lawn Dyarrig to increase?
answer1: increase on his blows and increase on his courage

question: Why did the lady tell Lawn Dyarrig to increase his blows and courage?
answer1: There was no woman here but herself to wail over him, or to stretch him before burial.

question: What did the knight do when he heard the voice?
answer1: rose in the air like a lump of fog

question: What happened after Lawn Dyarrig struck the knight with the sod?
answer1: He made a green stone out of him.

question: Where did Lawn Dyarrig find the three teeth of his father?
answer1: in a pocket of the Green Knight

question: What will happen if Lawn Dyarrig sends up the beautiful lady?
answer1: She may be taken from him by his brothers.

question: What did the maiden give Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: a ring

question: What did Ur use the horse's teeth for?
answer1: These would be his father's three teeth.

question: Who did Lawn Dyarrig meet while walking around?
answer1: Short-clothes

question: What did Lawn Dyarrig give Short-clothes?
answer1: five thin tyings dear and tight

question: Why did Lawn Dyarrig free Short-clothes?
answer1: When Short-clothes did not tell Lawn Dyarrig of his own will, Short-clothes must tell in spite of himself.

question: What will happen after Lawn Dyarrig shakes the old bridle?
answer1: A dirty, shaggy little foal will come and put its head in the bridle.

question: Where did the foal take Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: to Erin

question: Whose house did Lawn Dyarrig knock on?
answer1: an old weaver

question: What could Lawn Dyarrig do as a weaver?
answer1: spin for twelve and twist for telve

question: What happened when the old weaver and his sons tested Lawn Dyarrig's skills?
answer1: The work they had been doing for a year he had done in one hour.

question: Why did the old man begin to wash and shave?
answer1: Ur, son of the King, was to marry to-night to the woman that he took from the Green Knight of Terrible Valley.

question: What happened after dinner was over?
answer1: The old man began to wash and shave, and his two sons began to do the same.

question: Why did Lawn Dyarrig suppose he could go to the wedding without offense?
answer1: all were going to the wedding

question: What did the weaver make very quickly?
answer1: bags

question: What did Lawn Dyrraig do to the weaver's bag?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig put what dinner was on the first table into the weaver's bag, and sent the old man home with it.

question: Why was Ur complaining?
answer1: An impudent stranger was taking all the food.

question: What happened when Ur called for the fellow troubling the guests?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig was brought right away, and stood before the bride, who filled a glass with wine and gave it to him.

question: Who conquered the Green Knight and saved the maiden from Terrible Valley?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig

question: What happened after Lawn Dyarrig put the three teeth back in his father's mouth?
answer1: They fitted there perfectly, and grew into their old place.

question: How did the king feel when he got his teeth back?
answer1: satisfied

question: What did the bride give the queen?
answer1: a beautiful scarf

question: What happened to the queen after she said Ur's father was the King of Erin?
answer1: That moment the Queen thought that her head was in the sky and the lower half of her body down deep in the earth.

question: Who was Ur's father?
answer1: the gardener

question: Whose son was Arthur?
answer1: the swineherd

question: Who was the king's son?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig

question: Why did the scarf not tighten?
answer1: The queen told the truth that time.

question: What happened after the wedding was over?
answer1: The King gave Lawn Dyarrig half his kingdom, and made Ur and Arthur his servants.

question: What will the sons do after hearing what happened to their father?
answer1: look for the man
answer2: seek vengeance

question: How will Lawn Dyarrig feel when his father says he is not his son?
answer1: hurt
answer2: sad
answer3: unhappy

question: How will the brothers feel when they see the woman kiss Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: confused
answer2: jealous
answer3: offended

question: Why did the brothers take Lawn Dyarrig as a servant-boy?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig had nowhere to go.
answer2: Company wouldn't harm tem.

question: What happened to the men that never came back?
answer1: They were killed by the Green Knight.
answer2: They met with misfortune.
answer3: They died.

question: Why did Ur not agree to turn home?
answer1: He wanted vengeance for his father.
answer2: He did not believe the woman's story.
answer3: The woman vexed him.

question: Why did the woman treat Lawn Dyarrig differently from the brothers?
answer1: She knew he was destined to be the hero.
answer2: She knew he would defeat the Green Knight.
answer3: She knew Lawn Dyarrig's brothers were not destined to greatness.

question: Why did the woman think it was useless for Lawn Dyarrig to bring the brothers?
answer1: They were not going to help Lawn Dyarrig.
answer2: They were not destined to be heroes.
answer3: They would not defeat the Green Knight.

question: Why did Ur say he would not give one other sight on Terrible Valley?
answer1: He saw something terrible.
answer2: He was frightened.

question: Why did Lawn Dyraig need to reassure that his brothers would not put foul play on him?
answer1: He knew they did not like him.
answer2: He worried that the brothers wanted to get rid of him.
answer3: He put no foul play on them.

question: How will the mistress feel learning that Lawn Dyarrig has arrived?
answer1: excited
answer2: happy
answer3: joyful

question: Why was the mistress happy to see Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: She was going to be rescued.
answer2: She soon no longer had to serve the Green Knight.
answer3: She would soon be reunited with her father.

question: Why did the Green Knight invite the heroes to dinner?
answer1: He thought Lawn Dyarrig was coaxing his men.
answer2: He wanted to make sure his men were still on his side.
answer3: He wanted all of his men to return.

question: How will the Green Knight feel when his men does not come back?
answer1: worried
answer2: confused
answer3: fearful

question: Why did Lawn Dyarrig tell the knight he would be with him?
answer1: He was going to play a trick on the knight.
answer2: He wanted the knight to think his heroes were coming to dinner.
answer3: He did not want the knight to be suspicious.

question: Why did the mistress tell Lawn Dyarrig how to defeat the Green Knight?
answer1: She wanted him to be successful.
answer2: She wanted to return to her father.
answer3: She wanted the Green Knight to be gone forever.

question: How will Lawn Dyarrig feel when he defeats the Green Knight?
answer1: triumphant
answer2: victorious
answer3: proud

question: Why did Ur think about leaving what was below where it was?
answer1: He wanted to abandon Lawn Dyarrig.
answer2: He wanted the maiden for himself.
answer3: He did not want to lift Lawn Dyarrig up.

question: What did the brothers do when Lawn Dyarrig was ready to go back up?
answer1: The brothers took the lady.
answer2: The brothers did not lift Lawn Dyarrig up.
answer3: The brothers left Lawn Dyarrig down below.

question: Why did Short-clothes say Lawn Dyarrig was the best hero?
answer1: He wanted to be set free.
answer2: Lawn Dyarrig defeated the Green Knight.
answer3: Lawn Dyarrig gave him the tive thin tyings dear and tight.

question: Why did Short-clothes say he would help Lawn Dyarrig out of Terrible Valley?
answer1: Lawn Dyarrig freed him.
answer2: Lawn Dyarrig was not dead yet.
answer3: Lawn Dyarrig did not have death allotted to him.

question: How will Lawn Dyarrig feel when he hears that Ur is going to marry the woman?
answer1: angry
answer2: cheated
answer3: furious

question: What will Lawn Dyarrig do at the wedding?
answer1: surprise his brothers
answer2: reveal his ring
answer3: reunite with the woman

question: Why did Lawn Dyarrig drop the ring into the wine?
answer1: He knew the bride would recognize him.
answer2: He wanted to let the bride know who he was without letting Ur know.

question: How did the bride know who was standing beside her?
answer1: The ring went of itself with one leap on to her finger.
answer2: She remembered she gave a ring to Lawn Dyarrig.

question: How will the bride feel when she realizes the disturber is Lawn Dyarrig?
answer1: joyful
answer2: happy
answer3: gleeful

question: How was the scarf magical?
answer1: It could tighten under command.
answer2: It made the wearer speak the truth.
answer3: It could squeeze the wearer.

question: How will the king feel when he learns that Ur's father is the gardener?
answer1: shocked
answer2: angry
answer3: furious

question: Why did the scarf tighten around the queen?
answer1: The queen was not truthful.
answer2: The king was not Ur's father.

question: Why did the queen lie?
answer1: She did not want the king to know she was not faithful.
answer2: She did not want Ur or Arthur to know they were not the king's father.
answer3: She did not want to shame herself for being unfaithful.
